title: Comp - o virtus Sapientiae - Hildegard Symphoniae

content.description:
O virtus SapientiaeSapientia, -ae, f.: Wisdom (here, personified)
et circuienscircueo, -ire, -ii: to encircle circuisti,
comprehendendocomprehendo, -ere: to understand omnia,
trestres, tria, adj.: three alasala, -ae, f.: wing habens, 

Line 5quarum una ala in altum volat 
et altera de terra sudatsudo, -are: to sweat 
et tertiatertius, -a, -um, adj.: third undiqueundique, adv.: on all sides, all around volat.
content.question: From the passage, it can be inferred that Wisdom

choices.label: is like a bird with an extra wing
requires the strength of three people
knows when to lead and when to be led

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
